RESEARCH

The School of Fine Art's research is of high standing and research active staff include Christine Borland, Callum Innes, Julie Roberts, Ross Sinclair, Edward Stewart, Stephanie Smith, Alan Currall, Francis McKee and Thomas Joshua Cooper.

Opportunities for part-time and full-time programmes of research are available and we welcome applications for either mode.

The following is an outline indication of the topics in which we are interested in receiving proposals for research programmes. This is not a definitive list of our specialist interests and it does not include those current projects in which there are at present no opportunities for additional students. Enquiries about the following and other topics will be considered on their merits and on our capacity to provide appropriate expert supervision.

  • Painting and its cognates, including Drawing, Printmaking and artists' publications;
  • Photography, Time based Imaging and Electronic Media
  • Sculpture, Installation, Recorded and Live Performance
  • Curatorial, Critical and Editorial Practice - especially using the Glasgow School of Art Archive

To find our more about studying for a research degree at the GSA, please follow the links on the left.
